main event: A witness reported seeing a moon-like object with a long transparent tail and a brilliant cherry-red round body, flying at a tremendous speed with distinct color changes. The witness felt overawed by the potential for destruction and expressed a desire to share the information with authorities but hesitated due to the fear of ridicule.
interesting points: The witness observed the object between 10:30 and 11:00 PM at night while returning from Tarpon Springs to St. Petersburg in December 1948.
The object appeared to have a moon-like object with a long, transparent tail and a brilliant cherry-red round body, with distinct color changes.
The witness was struck by the different sizes of the two spheres and expressed a sense of wonder and curiosity about the nature of the sighting.
There was hesitance to report the sighting to authorities due to the fear of ridicule and an initial lack of knowledge about whom to contact.
The witness referenced an article in the Saturday Evening Post for an appropriate channel to share the information and expressed a desire for the topic of 'flying saucers' to be taken seriously.
sighted object: moon-like object with a long transparent tail and a brilliant cherry-red round body
